servers.description: Your Zylon instance (replace {base_url} with your actual hostname)

get.description: Initiates the OpenID login flow for the specified provider.
Initiates the OpenID login flow for the specified provider.
Handles the OpenID callback after authentication with the specified provider.

post.description: Login to the account using email and password. This will create a session for the user.

requestBody.description: Login with email and password

post.description: Create a new account with email and password.

requestBody.description: Create a new account with email and password

post.description: Clear the current session and logout the user.

requestBody.description: No body

post.description: Reset the account password for a given account ID. Regular hierarchy applies: SuperAdmin > Admin > others.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to reset the password

requestBody.description: No body required for this operation

get.description: Get all API tokens for the current user

post.description: Create a new API token for the current user. Only the hash of the token is stored in the database. The token in the response will be shared as clear text only once as the responseof this operation.

requestBody.description: The details of the API token to create

delete.description: Delete an API token by its hash

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The hash of the API token to delete

get.description: Get the account details for the specified account ID

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to retrieve

post.description: Update the account information for the specified account ID

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to update

requestBody.description: The updated account information

put.description: Update the current user's account information. At this moment only password change is available.Only the account owner can use this endpoint.

requestBody.description: The updated account information.

get.description: Get a list of accounts in the system

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The absolute page number to fetch (1-based).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page. Default is 20.

parameters.name: page_order
parameters.description: Sort order for pagination. Options: ASC, DESC. Default is ASC.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate after (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate before (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Limits the result to the first N items (after cursor).

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Limits the result to the last N items (before cursor).

parameters.name: total_count
parameters.description: Include the total count in the response.

get.description: Get all organizations that the current user can access

200.description: List of organizations accessible by the current user

post.summary: Join an organization by its ID.
post.description: Allows the current user to join an organization if the organization allows auto-join and the user's email matches the organization's email regex.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: The ID of the organization to join

requestBody.description: No body required for this operation

200.description: The user details after joining the organization

get.description: Retrieve the details of the currently authenticated user.

200.description: Returns the details of the currently authenticated user

get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific user by their ID.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to retrieve

200.description: Returns the details of the specified user

put.description: Update the details of a user, including optional profile picture upload.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to update

requestBody.description: Updated user information. Supports both JSON and multipart/form-data for profile picture uploads

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of users in the organization

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user states to filter by. Options: Active, Inactive. Default is Active,Inactive

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The absolute page number to fetch (1-based).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page. Default is 20.

parameters.name: page_order
parameters.description: Sort order for pagination. Options: ASC, DESC. Default is ASC.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate after (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate before (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Limits the result to the first N items (after cursor).

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Limits the result to the last N items (before cursor).

parameters.name: total_count
parameters.description: Include the total count in the response.

200.description: Returns a paginated list of users in the organization

post.summary: Add a user to the organization
post.description: Create a new user and add them to the current organization.

requestBody.description: User information to create

post.description: Set a user's state to inactive, effectively deactivating them.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to deactivate

requestBody.description: No body required for this operation

post.description: Set a user's state to active, effectively reactivating them.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user to activate

requestBody.description: No body required for this operation

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The absolute page number to fetch (1-based).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page. Default is 20.

parameters.name: page_order
parameters.description: Sort order for pagination. Options: ASC, DESC. Default is ASC.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate after (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate before (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Limits the result to the first N items (after cursor).

parameters.description: Number of latest artifacts to return. Default is 3

get.description: Retrieve a list of integrations configured for the current user.

post.description: Update the organization details for the currently authenticated user. This endpoint supports both JSON and multipart form data formats.

requestBody.description: The organization details to update. Can be sent as JSON or multipart form data.

post.description: Allows a user to leave a project they are currently a member of. This will remove them from the project and revoke their access.

parameters.description: The ID of the project to leave

requestBody.description: No additional data is required to leave a project

parameters.description: The ID of the project to transfer

requestBody.description: Contains the ID's of both the actual(old) and the next(new) project owner

parameters.description: The ID of the project to update

requestBody.description: The details to update the project with

parameters.description: The ID of the project to update

requestBody.description: The details to update the project with

get.description: Retrieve a list of artifacts nesting from a specific artifact

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifactId.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path of the artifact

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: The level of depth for the artifact children

200.description: Returns a list of artifacts for the specified artifact

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of artifacts for a specific project, with optional filtering and sorting parameters.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of artifact states to filter by. Example: 'Published,Processing'. If not provided, defaults to [Published, Processing].

parameters.name: ingest_status
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of artifact ingest statuses to filter by. Example: 'Ingested,Failed'. If not provided, defaults to all statuses.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of artifact types to filter by. Example: 'Document,Image'.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: The field by which to order the results. Example: 'createdAt', 'name'.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The sort order for the results: ASC for ascending, DESC for descending. Defaults to ASC.

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: Filter results by the user ID who created the artifact.

parameters.name: filter_by_text
parameters.description: Text to filter artifacts by. Performs a text search over artifacts.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Filter results by parent artifact ID.

parameters.name: filter_by_parent
parameters.description: If true, only artifacts with a parent ID will be included. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: sub_type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of artifact sub-types to filter by. Example: 'Image,Report'.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The absolute page number to fetch (1-based).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page. Default is 20.

parameters.name: page_order
parameters.description: Sort order for pagination. Options: ASC, DESC. Default is ASC.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate after (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The cursor or value to paginate before (for relative pagination).

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Limits the result to the first N items (after cursor).

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Limits the result to the last N items (before cursor).

parameters.name: total_count
parameters.description: Include the total count in the response.

200.description: Returns a paginated list of artifacts for the specified project

post.description: Create a new artifact and schedule it for processing.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

requestBody.description: The artifact to be created. This body can be submitted as either multipart/form-data (when including a file) or as JSON. Required fields include 'type' (artifact type) and 'name'. The 'config' field must contain a type-specific configuration object, matching the structure expected for the given artifact type. When uploading a file, include the file binary in 'fileData' (multipart only). Other optional fields allow setting metadata, description, parent relationships, external URLs, and ingestion behavior. Extra metadata (in 'metadata') is used internally and not stored persistently.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific artifact by its ID, including metadata, references, and optionally the content.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact to retrieve

parameters.name: include_content
parameters.description: If true returns the content of the artifact

put.description: Update the metadata of an existing artifact. This does not change the content of the artifact, but allows updating fields like name, description, metadata, and other properties.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact data to be updated

requestBody.description: The fields of the artifact to be updated

delete.description: Permanently delete an artifact and all its associated data, including vectors, interactions, and metadata. This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact data to be updated

get.summary: Get secure download URL for an artifact
get.description: Retrieves a secure download URL for an artifact by its ID. This URL can be used to download the artifact content directly and is's only valid for a limited time.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact to download

200.description: Returns a secure URL to download the artifact content

get.summary: Get parsed content of an artifact
get.description: Retrieves the parsed content of an artifact by its ID. The parsed content is the way LLMs will use the artifact information, usuallyas markdown text.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact data to retrieve

200.description: Returns the parsed content of the artifact as a string in markdown format

post.description: Synchronizes an artifact with the latest data from its source. Generally only used for external integrations that support live updates.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project

parameters.name: artifactId
parameters.description: The ID of the artifact data to be updated

requestBody.description: No body required for this operation

requestBody.description: The feedback to create

get.description: Get feedback for a target node

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: The ID of the target node to get feedback for
